<!-- About section --> 
```{=html}
<div id="intro" class="column-screen page-columns page-full section-light">
  <div class="column-screen-inset">

    <section class="about-section">
      <div class="about-eyebrow">ABOUT THE PLATFORM</div>

      <div class="about-layout">
        <div class="about-heading">
          <h2 class="about-title">
            About the K4GGWA Knowledge Platform
          </h2>
        </div>

        <div class="about-body">
          <p>
            Knowledge for Great Green Wall Action (K4GGWA) is a joint initiative of
            <strong>CIFOR-ICRAF</strong> and the
            <strong>Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)</strong>,
            funded by the <strong>European Union</strong>. The platform brings together
            stories, data, and tools to support decision-making across the Great Green Wall region.
          </p>

          <p>
            Here you can explore data and restoration stories from across the Sahel and Horn of Africa,
            access state-of-land analyses and reports, and follow key workshops and events.
            The <strong>K4GGWA Dashboard</strong> provides interactive maps and visualisations
            to help partners monitor landscape change, assess risks and opportunities,
            and track progress towards Great Green Wall goals.
          </p>

          <div class="about-logos">
            <img src="assets/logo_header.png" alt="K4GGWA Partners">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </section>

  </div>
</div>
```

```{=html}
<section id="why-maps" class="why-maps-section is-collapsed">

<div class="why-maps-backgrounds-wrapper">
  <div class="why-maps-background is-active" data-step="0">
    <img src="assets/why1.png" alt="">
  </div>
  <div class="why-maps-background" data-step="1">
    <img src="assets/why5.jpg" alt="">
  </div>
  <div class="why-maps-background" data-step="2">
    <img src="assets/why3.png" alt="">
  </div>
  <div class="why-maps-background" data-step="3">
    <img src="assets/why6.png" alt="">
  </div>
</div>

  <div class="why-maps-inner">

<div class="why-maps-block why-maps-step step-0 is-active" data-step="0">
  <div class="img"></div>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="step-content">
      <div class="inner-box">
        <span class="label">Landscape assessments</span>
        <h2>Establish a clear, evidence-based understanding of landscape conditions</h2>
        <p>
          Use high-resolution indicators on vegetation dynamics, soil conditions, and climate to understand landscape-scale trends, patterns and build a reliable baseline. Spatial data help identify opportunities, risks and data gaps, supporting realistic and cost-effective project appraisal.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="why-maps-block why-maps-step step-1" data-step="1">
  <div class="img"></div>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="step-content">
      <div class="inner-box">
        <span class="label">Targeting and prioritisation</span>
        <h2>Focus resources where restoration is most likely to deliver impact</h2>
        <p>
          Combine multiple indicators to identify and prioritise areas with strong ecological potential and favourable implementation conditions. This supports strategic use of limited budgets, reduces project risk, and creates a shared, evidence-based foundation for coordination across partners.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="why-maps-block why-maps-step step-2" data-step="2">
  <div class="img"></div>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="step-content">
      <div class="inner-box">
        <span class="label">Intervention design</span>
        <h2>Match restoration practices to local conditions for better performance</h2>
        <p>
          Spatial evidence provides critical information on site-level constraints from soil fertility, water availability, climate exposure, and land use, helping teams design and select interventions that are technically viable and affordable. Optimise project design, scope project trade-offs, and minimise surprises during implementation.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="why-maps-block why-maps-step step-3" data-step="3">
  <div class="img"></div>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="step-content">
      <div class="inner-box">
        <span class="label">Monitoring, evaluation and learning</span>
        <h2>Quantify progress, adapt strategies, and demonstrate results</h2>
        <p>
          Track landscape change with consistent and timely spatial metrics to understand where interventions are effective and where adjustments are needed. Quantified evidence strengthens accountability, supports adaptive management, and improves confidence among funders, partners, and local stakeholders.
        </p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

</div>


  <span class="why-line line-colored">
    <span class="why-line-filler"></span>
  </span>

  <span class="why-line line-track">
    <div class="why-next-step">
      <span class="why-icon-chevron"></span>
    </div>
  </span>

</section>
```
